definition: (of an organization etc) standing or permanent
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: Its permanent body is the Standing Committee of the National People’s Congress.
sentences.chinese: 它的常設機關是全國人民代表大會常務委員會。

sentences.english: The proposed standing international criminal court under discussion.
sentences.chinese: 擬設中的常設國際刑事法院的審議情況。

sentences.english: Standing free from dependence, conception, and self-conceit is the mark of liberation.
sentences.chinese: 常設擺脫依賴，概念，和自我虛榮心是解放的標誌。

sentences.english: The standard arbitration institution stipulates the procedures of arbitration and keeps the name list of the arbitrator.
sentences.chinese: 常設仲裁機構規定了仲裁手續，還備有仲裁人名簿。

sentences.english: There will be a report to the TDR Standing Committee.
sentences.chinese: 將向TDR常設委員會提交報告。

sentences.english: The establishment of a permanent secretariat to deal with day-to-day administrative matters.
sentences.chinese: 建立一個常設的祕書處處理日常行政事務。

sentences.english: Nor is China’s system as monolithic as foreigners often assume.
sentences.chinese: 中國也不像外國人常設想的那樣鐵板一塊。

sentences.english: He also called for a standing Senate observer group that can monitor and stay plugged into the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 他還建議設立參議院常設觀察組，以監督及介入討論。
常設機構”一語特別包括。

sentences.english: The executive office of the LSC is the Secretariat of the Localization Service Committee of TAC.
sentences.chinese: 常設工作機構爲中國譯協本地化服務委員會祕書處。

sentences.english: Its permanent body is the Standing Committee of the N ati onal People's Congress.
sentences.chinese: 它的常設機關是全國人民代表大會常務委員會。

definition: UNESCO, United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
first organized/to run sth for the first time
